args.natural_language_statement: Let p be a prime. Prove that if G is a finite group with exactly one Sylow p-subgroup, then that Sylow p-subgroup is normal in G.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open MulAction Subgroup
open Pointwise
open Equiv Equiv.Perm Finset Function List QuotientGroup

/-- Let p be a prime. Prove that if G is a finite group with exactly one Sylow p-subgroup, then that Sylow p-subgroup is normal in G. -/
theorem normal_of_unique_Sylow_subgroup {p : ℕ} [Group G] [Fact (Nat.Prime p)]
    [Finite (Sylow p G)] (h : Nonempty (Unique (Sylow p G))) : (↑h).choose.Normal := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let p be a prime. If G is a finite group with exactly one Sylow p-subgroup, then that Sylow
p-subgroup is normal in G. -/
theorem unique_sylow_normal {G : Type*} [Group G] [Fintype G] {p : ℕ} [Fact (Nat.Prime p)]
  (P : Subgroup G) (hP : IsSylow p P)
  (h_unique : ∀ Q : Subgroup G, IsSylow p Q → Q = P) : IsNormal P := by sorry
